block.p: Stella Ancie Levy and Dr. Isaac Cohen are to be married this evening by Rabbi Maurice Wohlgelernter at the Mamaroneck (N.Y.) Beach and Yacht Club.

The bride, 31, teaches fifth-grade English and history at the Hackley School in Tarrytown, N.Y. She graduated cum laude from Brandeis University and received a master's degree in education from the University of Bridgeport. She is the daughter of Harriet and Aaron Levy of Mount Vernon, N.Y.
Stella Ancie Levy and Dr. Isaac Cohen are to be married this evening by Rabbi Maurice Wohlgelernter at the Mamaroneck (N.Y.) Beach and Yacht Club.

The bride, 31, teaches fifth-grade English and history at the Hackley School in Tarrytown, N.Y. She graduated cum laude from Brandeis University and received a master's degree in education from the University of Bridgeport. She is the daughter of Harriet and Aaron Levy of Mount Vernon, N.Y.

The bridegroom, also 31, is a chief resident in physical medicine and rehabilitation at the Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx. He graduated from McGill University in Montreal and the Sackler School of Medicine in Tel Aviv. In August he is to begin a fellowship in spine and sports medicine at the New England Baptist Medical Center in Boston. He is a son of Ilana and Abraham Cohen of Montreal.
The couple met in 1998 through the Drip Cafe, a Manhattan coffee bar with a dating service.
